column4: i have 6.06 dapper and would like to upgrade to feisty fawn when it comes out.  I read that you must upgrade to edgy first and then upgrade to feisty.  Is this safe to do?  Will I lose any configuration settings?  How exactly do I do this?
go into /etc/apt and open sources.list, change every instance of dapper to edgy, and then run sudo apt-get update, sudo apt-get upgrade, sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
i checked the ubuntu website and it said that i should use gksu "update-manager -c" instead of what u said and that gksu "update-manager -c" is much more reliable.  Do you know of this?
